definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.chinese: 這種蝴蝶簡直就是耀眼奪目。

sentences.english: As time went on,his intelligence rayed out more brightly.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的推移，他的智慧之光愈加燦爛奪目。

sentences.english: A hundred bright yellow flowers grow.
sentences.chinese: 現在盛開着鮮豔奪目的一片小黃花。

sentences.english: Colorfully lit high- risers give off dazzling light in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 多姿多彩的高樓大廈，在夜色中絢爛奪目。

sentences.english: So dazzlingly radiant, it must be treasure rare.
sentences.chinese: 定是珍奇異寶，如此奪目璀璨。

sentences.english: Our loves are like flower similar and fresh and gorgeous brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 我們的愛像花兒一樣鮮豔奪目。

sentences.english: The peacock spreads his splendid tail.
sentences.chinese: 孔雀展開了它那燦爛奪目的尾巴。

sentences.english: The night air was as cold as water in the dim and quiet village with brilliant stars in the sky overhead.
sentences.chinese: 夜涼如水，走在幽暗寂靜的寨中，頭頂星空璨燦奪目。

sentences.english: My sister's silk cheongsam is shining in the light.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐的綢緞旗袍在燈光下顯得鮮妍奪目。

sentences.english: The renovated amusement park has a brand-new image.
sentences.chinese: 整修後的遊樂場新姿奪目。

sentences.english: In the moment of full bloom, brilliant edge will abstract all sight light.
sentences.chinese: 在盛開的一剎那，燦爛奪目的它會吸引所有的視線。

sentences.english: Wisdom is a gemstone. If set with modesty, it will be more beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 智慧是寶石，如果用謙虛鑲邊，就會更加燦爛奪目。

sentences.english: She burst through the double doors, in all her glory.
sentences.chinese: 她從兩門間衝進來，渾身光彩奪目。

sentences.english: FLASH OF LIGHTNING outside his window sends harsh barred shadows jittering across the cell. A storm breaking.
sentences.chinese: 閃電奪目，把牢房的柵影顫抖地映出，暴雨突來。

sentences.english: These old pieces of brass have polished up beautifully.
sentences.chinese: 這幾件古銅器被擦得洗亮奪目。

sentences.english: Coal Mine, the pear of Shandong Province, will be shining with even more dazzling glories.
sentences.chinese: 煤礦這顆齊魯明珠必將綻放更加耀眼奪目的光彩。

definition: nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
